content.question: Which of the following describes a contrasting political value?

choices.label: In Mexico, the government is limited to the same rules as its citizens, whereas in Russia the government uses the law to reinforce the authority of the state.
In Iran, the government is limited to the same rules as its citizens, whereas in Nigeria the government uses the law to reinforce the authority of the state.
In China, citizens value rule by law, whereas in Iran citizens value rule of law.
In Russia, citizens value rule of law, whereas in the United Kingdom citizens value rule by law.

content.answer: In Mexico, the government is limited to the same rules as its citizens, whereas in Russia the government uses the law to reinforce the authority of the state.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the implications of the similarities and differences between countries with different political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
